data.title: São Tomé and Príncipe
data.text:
São Tomé

21 Dec 1470 São Tomé discovered by João de Santarem and Pêro Escobar and claimed for Portugal. 1485 São Thomé a Portuguese colony (donataria). 19 Dec 1522 São Thomé a Portuguese crown colony. 9 Jul 1595 - 4 Jan 1596 São Thomé occupied by slaves during a revolt.

18 Oct 1599 - Nov 1599 Dutch occupation. 16 Oct 1641 - 6 Jan 1649 Dutch occupation. 19 Apr 1709 - 15 May 1709 French occupation. 29 Oct 1753 United with Principe to form colony of São Thomé and Príncipe (s.a.).

Dutch Occupation (1641-1649)

16 Oct 1641 - 6 Jan 1649 Dutch occupy São Tomé and Ano Bom (Annobón)(13 Nov 1642 - 16 Dec 1644 only in Fort St. Sebastiaan [São Sebastião], at Dutch factory to 6 Jan 1649).

Dutch West India Company Commanders (13 Nov 1642 - 16 Dec 1644 only in Fort St. Sebastiaan, at Dutch factory to 6 Jan 1649)16 Oct 1641 - 31 Oct 1641 Cornelis Cornelissen Jol (b. 1597 - d. 1641)31 Oct 1641 - 1642? Matheus Jansenc.27 Oct 1642 Jan Coendersc.29 Oct1642-c.16 Nov1642 Heijndrick Dominicus van der Nesc.14 Dec 1642 Gerrit Jansen Hasenbouth c.26 Jun 1643 Adam Tessmer c.1645 - Sep 1648 Johan Mulder (d. 1648) c.4 Oct 1648 - 6 Jan 1649 Laurens Jacobsen (commander)

Party abbreviations: ADI = Acção Democrática Independente (Independent Democratic Action, liberal, christian democratic, center-right, est.1994); MLSTP-PSD = Movimento de Libertação de São Tomé e Príncipe-Partido Social Democrata (Movement for the Liberation of São Tomé e Príncipe - Social Democratic Party, democratic socialist, former MLSTP, est.Oct 1990); PCD = Partido de Convergência Democrática (Democratic Convergence Party, split from MLSTP-PSD, former PCD-GR, est.2001); Mil = Military;

- Former parties: MDFM-PCD = Movimento Democrático Força da Mudança-Partido de Convergência Democrática (Force for Change Democratic Movement-Democratic Convergence Party, electoral coalition, 2002-May 2008); MDFM-PL = Movimento Democrático das Forças da Mudança-Partido Liberal (Force for Change Democratic Movement-Liberal Party, 2001-Aug 2018); MFA = Movimento das Forças Armadas (Movement of Armed Forces, organization of lower-ranked left-leaning Portuguese military officers, 1973-1976); MLSTP = Movimento de Libertação de São Tomé e Príncipe (Movement for the Liberation of São Tomé e Príncipe, MarxistLeninist commuinist, 1960-72 named Comité de Libertação de São Tomé e Príncipe [Committee for the Liberation of São Tomé and Príncipe], 12 Dec 1975 - Aug 1990, state party, 1972-Oct 1990, renamed MLSTP-PSD); PCD-GR = Partido de Convergência Democrática-Grupa de Reflexão (Democratic Convergence Party-Reflection Group, split from MLSTP-PSD, 4 Nov 1990-2001, renamed PCD)

Príncipe

Adopted Apr 2011

Variant fom c.2014

Map of Príncipe Capital: Santo António Regional Holiday:

29 Apr (1995)

Dia da Autonomia

(Autonomy Day)

Population: 8,420 (2018)

17 Jan 1471 Discovered and claimed for Portugal, named Ilha de Santo Antão

(António). 1500 - 1753 Separate Portuguese colony (donataria) under the Carneiro family. 1502 Renamed Príncipe. 9 Aug 1598 - 26 Nov 1598 Dutch occupation of Príncipe. 19 Jun 1719 English pirates under Bartholomew Roberts "Black Bart" (b. 1682

- d. 1722) destroy Santo António. 25 Oct 1753 Príncipe authorized to be bought by the Portuguese Crown;

donatary is made a count in exchange for the island. 29 Oct 1753 United with São Thomé to form colony of São Thomé and

Príncipe (s.a.). 15 Nov 1753 Office of capitão mór da ilha do Principe abolished. Dec 1981 Food shortages on Príncipe led to riots demanding the island's

autonomy.

29 Apr 1995 Autonomous Region of Príncipe (Região Autónoma do Príncipe)

established.
